Class EmptyNode

java.lang.Object
EmptyNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
IListOfBooks
public class EmptyNode extends Object implements IListOfBooks
Represents the end of a recursive list of books (an empty list). This class serves as the base case for all recursive operations on the list.

  • Method Details

    • count

      public int count()
      Returns the count of books in an empty list.
      Specified by:
      count in interface IListOfBooks
      Returns:
      0, as there are no books in an empty list.

    • totalPrice

      public float totalPrice()
      Returns the total price of all books in an empty list.
      Specified by:
      totalPrice in interface IListOfBooks
      Returns:
      0.0f, as an empty list has no price.

    • allBefore

      public IListOfBooks allBefore(int year)
      Returns a sublist containing books published before a certain year. Since the list is empty, it returns the same empty list.
      Specified by:
      allBefore in interface IListOfBooks
      Parameters:
      year - the year to filter by.
      Returns:
      this EmptyNode instance.

    • addAtEnd

      public IListOfBooks addAtEnd(Book book)
      Appends a book to the end of the list. Adding to an empty list results in a single-element list.
      Specified by:
      addAtEnd in interface IListOfBooks
      Parameters:
      book - the book to add to the end.
      Returns:
      a new ElementNode containing the book and this empty node as its rest.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns an empty string representing the contents of an empty list.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface IListOfBooks
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      an empty string.
